key_risks: Cybersecurity vulnerabilities and legal liabilities from class-action lawsuits
Supply chain disruptions due to reliance on global suppliers and semiconductor shortages
Regulatory risks from changes in energy efficiency standards and trade policies
Intense competition in the smart lighting and IoT space
controversies: Class-action lawsuit (Melissa Stark, et al. v. Acuity Brands, Inc.) over data security negligence
$15.75 million settlement in a 2018 class-action lawsuit involving former executives
environmental_issues: Commitment to reducing carbon footprint and advancing energy-efficient solutions, as outlined in the 2024 EarthLIGHT Report
social_issues: Potential reputational damage from cybersecurity breaches and legal settlements
governance_issues: Governance concerns highlighted by legal settlements and potential compliance issues

sources.snippet: A class action lawsuit filed in 2018 against Acuity Brands and some former executives appears to be nearing the end. sources.title: Acuity Brands Settles Antitrust Lawsuit Over Sales Partnership
sources.snippet: Acuity Brands Inc. and sales partner KSA Lighting & Controls Inc. have resolved federal antitrust litigation in Chicago challenging the structure of their distribution agreements. Acuity and KSA docketed a settlement Wednesday with Force Partners LLC, the rival lighting products distributor that brought the case.
